vital_signs.blood_pressure: 82/53 mmHg (95/60 mmHg after administration of 2L fluids)

relevant_findings.general: Alert and oriented x 3, no acute distress.
relevant_findings.HEENT: Pupils equal, round, reactive to light; extraocular movements intact; anicteric.
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, distended, normal bowel sounds, mildly tender suprapubically and in left lower quadrant, no rebound or guarding.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Vital signs initially in the 80's for systolic blood pressure but improved to 95/60 mmHg after fluid administration. No significant changes in other physical examination findings were reported.
